intro: Erigeron prantlii, commonly known as plains fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, meadows, and rocky soils, thriving in full sun. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron prantlii is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to dry, nutrient-poor environments.
